title.rendered: At 16, Kaamya Karthikeyan becomes the youngest Indian to summit Mt Everest.

content.rendered:
India’s Kaamya Karthikeyan became the youngest Indian to scale Mount Everest, peaking at 8,849 meters on the Nepal side. She is also the second youngest in the world to climb Everest. During his journey, his father, a member of the Indian Navy, Cadr. S Karthikeyan also helped him climb Mount Everest. Western Naval Command visited X to congratulate the father and daughter duo.

They wrote: “Ms. Kaamya Karthikeyan, a 16-year-old student of Class XII of the Navy Children’s School, Mumbai, along with her father, Cdr S Karthikeyan of the Indian Navy, successfully climbed Mount Everest (8,849 m). 20, 24.”

Sharing this tweet, the Indian Navy said, “#IndianNavy congratulates Ms. Kaamya Karthikeyan d/o Cdr S Karthikeyan for becoming the world’s youngest and second #Indian girl to summit Mount Everest from on the Nepali side. Kaamya showed great courage and bravery by recording the sixth highest peak in the seven continents.”

Kaamya Karthikeyan

“#IndianNavy wishes young Kaamya all the best in her quest to top all seven continents, becoming the last girl to do so,” they added.
Happy with his achievements, netizens posted congratulatory messages on the post. One of your Warfrre wrote: “It’s just a great story. Kamya is a great plenomenal. I remember the Special Navy Day 2021 that I confirmed to be a guest on. Her confidence, beauty and boldness belied her young age. One can immediately see that he is the winner of many top scores. Additionally, @Indiannavy Media can check if this video is still available.The show was broadcast on the Navy’s YouTube channel. @PadmajaParulkar”
Meanwhile, the other person said, “Wow. What a great achievement!

The news came a day after Arunachal Pradesh’s Kabak Yano etched her name in history by becoming the fifth woman from the state to scale Mount Everest. She was the first woman from the Nyishi tribe to do this. Yano accomplished this remarkable feat at 11:50 am on Tuesday alongside five other members of the summit team Babu Sherpa, Ngima Dorjee Sherpa, Subash Rai, Lakpa Nurbu Sherpa and Shere Sherpa all hailing from Nepal.
